attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds the vote in future elections and referenda.
attributes.additional_details:
Surveys suggest 16-17 year olds were even more pro remain than 18-20 year olds but did not get a vote in the EU referendum which was won by less votes than the 16-17 population would have.

The Electoral Reform Society said "The Scottish independence referendum showed once and for all that 16 & 17 year-olds are more than capable of taking important political decisions"

Whether it is local or national elections, we need to encourage young people to be involved rather than shut the door on them.
attributes.background:
As an informed 16 year old, I am excluded from the political process.  
1.5m 16 & 17 year olds have no democratic right. That needs to change

We should be able to have our say too. We have to live with the consequences of decisions for longer than other age group and deserve to be heard.
